description: The tMirrorSourceEnabled event is generated when the mirror
source is enabled.
The mirror destination service ID that defines the context of
the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex

description: The tMirrorSourceDisabled event is generated when the mirror
source is disabled.
The mirror destination service ID that defines the context of
the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex

description: The tMirrorDestinationEnabled event is generated when the mirror
destination is enabled.
Since packet mirroring is setup like a service,
tMirrorDestinationIndex represents the Service ID
associated with this mirror destination. It is
used as unique index in to this table. Only 255
mirror destination service IDs may be created per
system.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorDestinationIndex

description: The tMirrorDestinationDisabled event is generated when the mirror
destination is disabled.
Since packet mirroring is setup like a service,
tMirrorDestinationIndex represents the Service ID
associated with this mirror destination. It is
used as unique index in to this table. Only 255
mirror destination service IDs may be created per
system.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorDestinationIndex

description: The tMirrorSourceRemovedBySystem event is generated when the
mirror source is removed by the system.
The mirror destination service ID that defines the context of
the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex

description: The tMirrorSourceIpFilterChange event is generated when a IP filter or
filter entry associated with the mirror-source indicated by
tMirrorSourceIndex is 'modified' or 'deleted'. If the only the base
filter is modified, tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId will have a value
of 0.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIpFilterChange TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterId u 9999 TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId u 9999 TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceChangeType i 1

description: The mirror destination service ID that defines the context of
the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterId specifies the filter id
for which this notification is being sent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterId

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId specifies the entry
in the filter for which this notification is being sent.
If set to 0, the attempted modification was to a global
filter parameter.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId

description: The value of tMirrorSourceChangeType specifies the type of
change made to a IP or MAC filter, IP or MAC filter entry,
sap, or subscriber associated with a configured mirror-source
as indicated by the value of tMirrorSourceIndex.
The values 'activated' and 'deactivated' apply only to
subscriber IDs as indicated by the value of tMirrorSourceSubIdent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceChangeType

description: The tMirrorSourceMacFilterChange event is generated when a MAC
filter or filter entry associated with the mirror-source indicated by
tMirrorSourceIndex is 'modified' or 'deleted'. If the only the base
filter is modified, tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId will have a value
of 0.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceMacFilterChange TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterId u 9999 TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId u 9999 TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceChangeType i 1

the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterId specifies the filter id
for which this notification is being sent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterId

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId specifies the entry

If set to 0, the attempted modification was to a global

variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterEntryId

description: The value of tMirrorSourceChangeType specifies the type of
change made to a IP or MAC filter, IP or MAC filter entry,
sap, or subscriber associated with a configured mirror-source
as indicated by the value of tMirrorSourceIndex.
The values 'activated' and 'deactivated' apply only to

variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceChangeType

description: The tMirrorSourceSapChange event is generated when a SAP associated
with the mirror-source indicated by tMirrorSourceIndex is 'modified'
or 'deleted'.
The mirror destination service ID that defines the context of
the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex

description: The ID of the access port for the Service Access Point (SAP)
associated with the mirror source defined by tMirrorSourceIndex.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceSapPortId

description: The value of the label used to identify the SAP on the
access port specified by tMirrorSourceSapPortId.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceSapEncapValue

description: The value of tMirrorSourceChangeType specifies the type of
change made to a IP or MAC filter, IP or MAC filter entry,
sap, or subscriber associated with a configured mirror-source
as indicated by the value of tMirrorSourceIndex.
The values 'activated' and 'deactivated' apply only to
subscriber IDs as indicated by the value of tMirrorSourceSubIdent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceChangeType

description: The tMirrorSourceSubChange event is generated when a subscriber
associated with the mirror-source indicated by tMirrorSourceIndex
is 'activated', 'deactivated', 'modified' or 'deleted'.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceSubChange TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceSubIdent s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceChangeType i 1

description: The mirror destination service ID that defines the context of
the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceIndex

description: The value of tMirrorSourceSubIdent specifies the subscriber
identification of this subscriber on this mirror source.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceSubIdent

description: The value of tMirrorSourceChangeType specifies the type of
change made to a IP or MAC filter, IP or MAC filter entry,
sap, or subscriber associated with a configured mirror-source
as indicated by the value of tMirrorSourceIndex.
The values 'activated' and 'deactivated' apply only to
subscriber IDs as indicated by the value of tMirrorSourceSubIdent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceChangeType

description: The tMirrorSourceIPFltrChangeReject event is generated when
an operator is trying to modify a filter or a filter-entry
of a filter that cannot currently be changed because the
filter is being used for mirrorring.

event.Summary: Mirror source $v1 IP filter $v2 modification rejected

the mirror source. The mirror destination service represented
by this ID must exist as an entry within the tMirrorDestinationTable.

description: The tMirrorSourceFilterAssignReject event is generated when
an operator is trying to modify a filter assignment
of a filter that cannot currently be changed because the
filter is being used for mirrorring.

event.Summary: Mirror source filter assignment rejected due to $v2

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterObject specifies which
object (containing a filter) the operator tried to change.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterObject

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterDescr specifies additional
information on the reason for sending the event.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterDescr

description: The tMirrorDestinationChangeReject event is generated when
an operator is trying to modify a mirror destination
that cannot currently be changed because the destination
is being used for mirrorring.
Since packet mirroring is setup like a service,
tMirrorDestinationIndex represents the Service ID
associated with this mirror destination. It is
used as unique index in to this table. Only 255
mirror destination service IDs may be created per
system.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorDestinationIndex

description: The tMirrorSourceFilterOverruled event is generated when
an assignment of a filter used for mirroring is overruled
with another filter assignment.
This situation may occur while using Time-Of-Day Suites.

event.Summary: Mirror source filter overruled due to $v2

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterObject specifies which
object (containing a filter) the operator tried to change.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterObject

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterDescr specifies additional
information on the reason for sending the event.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterDescr

description: The tMirrorSourceFilterAssignWarn event is generated when
an operator has made a filter assignment of a filter that is being
used for mirrorring, while that assignment may be overruled.

event.Summary: Mirror source filter assignment warning detected due to $v2

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterObject specifies which
object (containing a filter) the operator tried to change.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterObject

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterDescr specifies additional
information on the reason for sending the event.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterDescr

to which this notification applies.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorFilterSapEncapValue

description: The value of tMirrorFilterType specifies the

description: The value of tMirrorFilterDirection specifies the

description: The value of tMirrorFilterId specifies the

description: The tMirrorSourceLiFilterChanged event is generated when a parameter
of a filter which is referenced by Lawful Intercept (LI),or a
parameter of one of its entry has been changed.
[CAUSE]
This notification may be triggered only if LI filter lock has been
overruled, and one of the following actions has been done:
1) a filter referenced by LI has been deleted.
2) one of the parameters (default-action, scope) of a filter which
is referenced by LI has been changed.
3) a filter which is referenced by LI has been overwritten.
4) new entry has been created for a filter which is referenced by LI.
5) an entry of a filter which is referenced by LI has been activated.
6) an entry has been removed from a filter which is referenced by LI.
7) an entry of a filter which is referenced by LI has been
renumbered.
8) one of the parameters of an entry in a filter which is referenced
by LI has been changed.
[EFFECT]
Since a filter which is referenced by LI, or its parameter has been
modified, the mirrored traffic may be changed.

event.Summary: Mirror source LI filter changed due to $v2

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterObject specifies which
object (containing a filter) the operator tried to change.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterObject

description: The value of tMirrorSourceFilterDescr specifies additional
information on the reason for sending the event.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MIRROR-MIB::tMirrorSourceFilterDescr
